This is the time, after becoming inactive, at which we start looking at the motion sensor to determine if the device is being left alone. We don\'t do this immediately after going inactive just because we don\'t want to be continually running the significant motion sensor whenever the screen is off

If we don\'t receive a callback from AnyMotion in this amount of time + locating_to, we will change from STATE_SENSING to STATE_INACTIVE, and any AnyMotion callbacks while not in STATE_SENSING will be ignored
This is how long we will wait to try to get a good location fix before going in to idle mode
The desired maximum accuracy (in meters) we consider the location to be good enough to go on to idle. We will be trying to get an accuracy fix at least this good or until locating_to expires
This is the time, after seeing motion, that we wait after becoming inactive from that until we start looking for motion again
This is the time, after the inactive timeout elapses, that we will wait looking for significant motion until we truly consider the device to be idle
This is the initial time, after being idle, that we will allow ourself to be back in the IDLE_PENDING state allowing the system to run normally until we return to idle
Maximum pending idle timeout (time spent running) we will be allowed to use
Scaling factor to apply to current pending idle timeout each time we cycle through that state
This is the initial time that we want to sit in the idle state before waking up again to return to pending idle and allowing normal work to run
Maximum idle duration we will be allowed to use
Scaling factor to apply to current idle timeout each time we cycle through that state
This is the minimum time we will allow until the next upcoming alarm for us to actually go in to idle mode
Max amount of time to temporarily whitelist an app when it receives a high tickle
Amount of time we would like to whitelist an app that is receiving an MMS
Amount of time we would like to whitelist an app that is receiving an SMS
This is the time, after becoming inactive, that we go in to the first light-weight idle mode
This is amount of time we will wait from the point where we decide we would like to go idle until we actually do, while waiting for jobs and other current activity to finish
This is the initial time that we will run in idle maintenance mode
Scaling factor to apply to the light idle mode time each time we complete a cycle
This is the maximum time we will run in idle maintenance mode
This is the minimum amount of time we want to make available for maintenance mode when lightly idling
This is the maximum amount of time we want to make available for maintenance mode when lightly idling
This is the minimum amount of time that we will stay in maintenance mode after a light doze
This is the minimum amount of time that we will stay in maintenance mode after a full doze
Amount of time we would like to whitelist an app that is handling a notification
Maintenance mode light idle min timeout
Maintenance mode light idle max timeout
Maintenance mode light doze min timeout
Maintenance mode full doze min timeout

Prevent burn-in by shifting pixels every

Smart Pixels is a power saving feature. Depending on how many pixels you decide to turn off, you could see a significant improvement in battery life. For a good user experience, we recommend setting the amount of disabled pixels to 75 percent while shifting every 10 minutes.
Tap here to visit our awesome website!
Tap here to visit our Twitter!
Tap here to visit our amazing community!
Tap here to open our GitHub!

Evolution X is a flashable custom ROM to bring a true Pixel feel to your Android Device at first glance, with many additional configurations at your disposal. We aim to provide frequent builds with monthly security patches from the latest aosp sources!

"This option requires you to restart your device.
Would you like to do that now?"

"This option requires a SystemUI restart.
Would you like to do that now?"

"To avoid visual color glitches, SystemUI has to be restarted.
Do you want to continue?"

"The dark themes can be applied in 2 ways:
1-Compatible 2-Forced
Compatible requiers a SystemUI restart, keeps "Monet" colors and, because of that, not every color will be themed. Bummer...
Forced disables Monet colors, as well as, gestures navigation, gets reset upon reboot or SystemUI restart (since Monet will kick in again) BUT everything will be themed accordingly. It sucks but it's like this on stock Android 12.
The best alternative is to use Repainter app by kdrag0n...
Anyway, even if you choose Forced, you may enable gestures afterwards as well as get back all Monet colors, as explained. The choice is yours.
So, what will it be, Compatible or Forced?"
Please enable gestures navigation on system settings
Please have in mind that, by disabling this option, all vibrations will be disabled on the device!
Please, disable colored pill option first and restart the app.
Please, disable hide pill option first and restart the app.

"Edge Sense Plus is an app built by @j to the 4n, back in 2019, that allows users to set other actions, rather than just opening Google Assistant, by squeezing the phone.
This app required a Magisk module to be installed as well but, it has been a long time since the module has been updated to newest SystemUI builds.
Well, now it has been, by yours truly, and it's already merged into Addon Features SystemUI module so, if your device has edge sensors (and only if it has) you now may enjoy Edge Sense Plus instead of default Active Edge by Google.
Please notice that, it's possible that E.S.P. requires Google Assistant app installed through Play Store in order to use "Open Assistant" feature. And, even so, it's possible that you can't choose Assistant option, you would have to choose the option to open an app and choose Google Assistant app as the one you want to open. For more info about this, please just visit original XDA thread.
If you choose to install the app, don't forget to press IGNORE on the first popup you'll see after opening the app on your drawer.
So, do you want to install Edge Sense Plus app? If your device has this sensor, I bet you want..."

"This option will uninstall Edge Sense Plus app.
Are you sure you want to do that?"

"Tap Tap is an awesome app created by @Quinny899. It allows to use the tap gesture, on the back of the device, to trigger several different actions instead of the default ones by Google.
This app is so cool that it works even on a device that doesn't have Quick Tap feature. I've downloaded the app from official GitHub and decided to include it here so more users could try it out.
It's truly an amazing work so, if you decide to install the app, don't forget to thank Quinny899 for this and, if you want updates, just enable the Allow Internet permission on the app settings.
Do you want to install Tap Tap? If you do, the app will appear on your app drawer."

"This option will uninstall Tap Tap app.
Are you sure you want to do that?"
Display and customize battery bar near status bar or navigation bar

Full → empty: red ← green ← blue ← red
Full → empty: red → green → blue → red
